title: Divoké sny Maxipsa Fíka
overview: The rather overgrown dog Fík was invented by the writer Rudolf Čechura and painted by the painter Jiří Šalamoun. And since even dogs have dreams, our maxips also find something exciting and funny. Let the actor Josef Dvořák narrate it, who also lent his voice to Fík in a TV evening. And what did Fík actually dream? For example, how he played soccer, how he drove a car, how he experienced Christmas and how he became, imagine, the helmsman of a real ocean liner...
